description:
Gurlz VS Robots is a multiplayer game in which Gurlz and robots are spawned on the screen. They walk in straight lines. Each player can place a fixed number of arrows on the screen that makes Gurlz and Robots change directions. The aim is to guide the robots to the escape pod of your colour. The player who saves the most robots wins, but points are detracted for Gurlz that make their way into a player's escape pod.

The game is played in real-time with two to four players. Players can constantly place arrows in order to guide the ever advancing robots and Gurlz in desired directions. When a player has played his maximum number of arrows any newly placed arrow will remove an older one.

The game comes with various different levels and is displayed in a top-down retro arcade look.
title: Gurlz VS Robots

description: Because, like Breakout, no platform is complete until it has its own port, this is the iPad's welcome party to the community of real gaming platforms: its own conversion of ADVENTURE, the original (!) text adventure game, sending virtual spelunkers in search of underground treasures in a magical, factual cave complex for over three decades now, accepting player input through a two-word text parser on machines as diverse as the PDP-10 minicomputer (enshrined here in the game's help and history section, along with hints, maps and the game's original source code!) to Apple's newest and latest. All game output is written on the screen as though through an imaginary teletype terminal, and the iPad's virtual on-screen keyboard is quite handy for entering the player's instructions. Background illustrations help to establish the scene, and text display sound effects reinforce the terminal metaphor.
title: iAdventure

description:
Perfect Balance is a physics puzzle game where the objective is to stack the given shapes so that none falls off the screen.

This HD version contains all four iPhone Perfect Balance games (Harmony, Inferno, Paradise and Lost Trials) and their 340 levels, though some levels have been modified a little. The game also contains a new bonus mode, 1024x768 graphics, improved controls, and new particle effects and support for OpenFeint.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 8 of Perfect Balance: Harmony (in bonus mode 2)

title: Perfect Balance HD

description:
The Intruder is the first episode in a four-part series based on the Jurassic Park franchise that started with a first movie in 1993. The game takes place both concurrently and after during the events of the first movie, but has none of the original characters or cast. It is set on Isla Nublar, the original island where the Jurassic Park with living dinosaurs is established. The story starts with different scenes that introduce the characters in a mixed-up chronology. It has Gerry Harding, the chief veterinarian of the park who shows his daughter Jess around. There is also Miles Chadwick and the professional smuggler Nima Cruz, two contacts sent by Dennis Nedry (from the original movie) who has a plan to shut down the park and run off with dinosaur embryos. But when the park's security systems go down and the dinosaurs roam freely, their plans are foiled. This first episode focuses largely on Nima Cruz as she investigates what happened to Nedry, tries to escape, and is bitten by a strange dinosaur. As Gerry and Jess make their way to the port, they come across Nima who is unconscious and they take her along to reach the visitor center and escape from a giant T-Rex. There they learn that the original cast has already left the island. From then on the three band together and the player controls Gerry as he tries to find a way off the island.

The game is largely presented as an interactive movie. It consists of different animated scenes with visual clues where the player can interact, similar to the controls in Heavy Rain. These are used to manipulate items, examine objects in the environments, choose topics for conversations, but also include many quick time events where the player has to react quickly or perform quick actions such as centering a dot to steady someone's mind or adjusting the frequency of a radio. If a sequence is successfully performed, the story continues until another opportunity to interact arises. There is no complete freedom of movement, instead it consists of a series of linked scenes. There are however opportunities where players can observe the environment in any direction (to find the location of new clues or hot spots) and often there is a choice between different locations to go to. Unlike earlier Telltale games players can die if a sequence is not performed successfully. The game then automatically restarts at an earlier checkpoint to retry. This is can be done an unlimited amount of times. As expected there are many encounters with dinosaurs, in fighting or escape sequences.
title: Jurassic Park: The Game - Episode 1: The Intruder

description:
Imperfect Balance HD is a physics puzzle game where the objective is to make as many blocks fall off the screen as possible, or vanish by other means. The game is made by the same people who made Perfect Balance HD, and the rules of the game are pretty much the opposite of those implemented there.

This HD version contains all three Flash Imperfect Balance games and their 150 levels, though some levels have been modified and some replaced with others. The game also contains 1024x768 resolution graphics, improved controls, and support for OpenFeint and Game Center.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level completed with a Perfect Strike, i.e. the player destroyed all blocks

title: Imperfect Balance HD

description: Ogs is a two-player single-screen multiplayer game. Both players can drop creatures called Ogs on their side of the board, with the aim of conquering the other side. Each Og has different speeds and movement patterns similar to the toys in Gearheads. Different Ogs also come with different costs and abilities. To pay for Ogs the player must collect energy on the board by tapping it when it comes available.
title: Ogs

description:
Unlike most games, Game for Cats is not meant for us humans, but as the name implies: for cats. It comes with various mini-games that are designed to appeal to cats such as a laser dot to chase and a mouse to follow. A butterfly was added in a later update.

The game keeps a score for the cat which can be uploaded to Facebook, Twitter and Game Center. The cat scores when he or she hits the object on the screen, this event is accompanied with a sound.
title: Game for Cats

description:
Gua-Le-Ni; or, The Horrendous Parade, is an action-puzzle casual videogame for the Apple iPad.

One of its most distinguishing traits is that the game solely takes place on the wooden desk of an old, befuddled British taxonomist. On his desk, lies a fantastic book: a bestiary populated by impossible, finely drawn animals. Not unlike all the monsters of myths and folklores, Gua-Le-Ni’s impossible beasts are combinations of parts of real animals. To understand what I mean, it might help to think of fantastic creatures like the sphinx, the Minotaur, different chimeras or even South Park’s Manbearpig.

Such animal parts can vary from two to four animal parts. Each animal part, either a head or a body part, is reproduced on a taxonomic cube that can be rotated, flipped and moved until it matches the corresponding part of the passing animal. The goal of the game is precisely that of reconstructing the animals before they reach the end of the page-screen and disappear. When a match between the paper beast and the beast represented on the upper faces of the taxonomic cubes is accomplished, points are scored.

Different game modes are present in the game's fantastic bestiary, some of which are purely focusing on mnemonic tasks, on action mechanics such as feeding and optimized manipulation of the taxonomic cubes.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Ti-Ster-Ster wobbles its way across a page of Gua-Le-Ni's fabulous bestiary.

title: Gua-Le-Ni, or: The Horrendous Parade

description:
The Last Flight of the Bumble Bee is a vertically-scrolling shoot-em-up created in 48 hours for the 2011 Global Game Jam in Melbourne. The focus is not to shoot enemies, instead the player is attempting to pollinate flowers. Players gather pollen by hovering their bee over a flower and then deliver that pollen to another flower of the same color to score 100 points. Shooting enemies makes progress easier, but does not contribute directly to the score.

The game also features a bomb function which converts nearby enemy bullets into honey. This honey damages enemies and each droplet is collected for 1 point. Careful use of the honey bomb can create long chains of honey as more bullets stick to the existing honey droplets. The game features a boss battle against a large dragonfly enemy, after which it begins again but at a harder difficulty and with more flower colors.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using the honey-bomb against the dragonfly boss.

title: The Last Flight of the Bumble Bee

description: Attack of the Kittens is a 2D shooting game. The player controls a gunner's base at the bottom of the screen and needs to destroy any incoming kittens coming down from the top using parachutes, hang gliders and helicopters. The gunner can be upgraded by earning money while progressing through the game. There are seven areas and 56 levels in total.
title: Attack of the Kittens

description:
Puerto Rico is based on the popular German board game of the same name. As in the original version, the players choses each turn between roles of mayors, builders, settlers, traders, captains, and craftsmen. Each role gives an advantage but allows a certain action for all players. A special title known as the governor is the first player to choose a role, however it rotates after each turn.

The player needs to construct buildings, raise plantations, sell goods and acquire colonists to get enough points before the game is over. To succeed the player needs to balance the income for construction, the workforce (known as colonists) for goods production, and points.. As with most board games, the player with the most point at the end is the winner.
title: Puerto Rico HD

description:
In Gasketball the player controls a flying robot. The game is inspired by basketball as the purpose is to net the ball in the basket. Levels are full of reflecting surfaces and other objects (magical portals, spinning saw blades, ...) mostly taken from the world of pinball to increase the difficulty on one side and give chance to get higher scores on the other side (for example, if the ball ends in the basket after bouncing on the reflecting surfaces in the requested order).

There are 5 shot attempts in each level playing the standard mode. At the end of the level a score is given. For accurate and successful shots, more points are awarded. The performance is also rated by stars (from 1 to 3). The title screen shows the main game modes. Singe player (Play and Practice modes) and multiplayer (H.O.R.S.E. and "1 on 1"). H.O.R.S.E. mode is a level editor: the created levels can be given as a challenge to other players online (and vice versa: the player will face levels created by their challenger). A "trash talk" option allows to send challenging words together with the level. 1 on 1 challenges are played by splitscreen on the same iPad. In Challenge arenas, the player must satisfy specific requirements to clear levels (e.g. making the ball bounce at least 2 times before going into the basket).

Four different robots are available later in the game (only one at the beginning). The game is controlled through the touch screen.
title: Gasketball

description:
The 7th Guest: Infection is a puzzle game for two players based on the microscope game from The 7th Guest. The game is played on a Reversi/Othello-grid, but with a 7x7 grid rather then 8x8, where the objective is to end up with more pieces then the opponent. Each player starts with two game pieces, known as microbes or cells, in diagonal corners. The player can make two possible moves each turn, either creating a new microbe adjacent in any 8 directions to a current microbe, or move a microbe two positions away, and losing the original position. In any case the destination has to be unoccupied, and all of the opponent's microbes adjacent to the new cell will be captured by the player who moved the cell.

Infection can be played against Henry Stauf, the main antagonist from The 7th Guest, with 7 difficulty levels. As in the original game, Stauf often taunts the players between moves. There is also a Mono Y Mono option where two human players can play together on the same device, and a Demo mode where the AI controls both players.

The game was created as a stand alone game partly because the iOS version of The 7th Guest lacked this puzzle, due to technical obstacles.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lab notes also includes the credits

title: The 7th Guest: Infection

description: iLunolet is based on the classic Lunar Lander. The game consists of a single screen on which the player has controls for the lander's thrust and direction. The objective is to take-off, dock with an orbiting space station and land again all on limited amounts of fuel. The game also has controls that pause the game, speed up the action and the 'pinch' action can be used to magnify or reduce the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is the game screen at the start of the game. All the controls are clearly labelled and explained (v1.20).
When the game is sped up it is possible to go very wrong, very quickly. This screenshot also illustrates that the scale of the display can be changed (v1.20).
There are very specific criteria for a successful docking. This attempt did not meet them (v1.20).

title: iLunolet

description:
Lionel Battle Train is a tower defense on rails game that asks players to make deliveries across various terrains using a train that can be customized with weapons and armor. The game is set in a futuristic place which has been terrorized by the evil Dr. DeRaille, and where people have relied on the Lionel Delivery Company for 100 years for the safe delivery of their goods. The player's objective is to deliver cargo to people across three regions: the prairie, desert and mountains. Each mission becomes increasingly difficult and requires players to arm their trains with more advanced weaponry as Dr. DeRaille dispatches more powerful RoboCars to prevent the player from making deliveries. The player must successfully complete each mission to advance to the next level.

The game is free-to-play and offers in-app purchases to make the trains more powerful.
title: Lionel Battle Train

description: This is a story made with Versu, a choice-based engine presenting play through interaction between player characters and non-player characters (NPCs); the social element of the gameplay results in something more akin to interactive drama than interactive fiction. It is primarily concerned with schemes and background power plays in the milieu of Imperial Rome, circa 68 A.D., at the end of Nero's reign. The player controls poet Marcus, who needs to satisfy a demand made of his patron Artus to consult an oracle. How he obtains the information sought by the patron, whose assistance he employs, and to what underhanded lengths he goes to achieve it -- not limited to blackmail, seduction, and outright violence.
title: Blood and Laurels

description:
Paper vs Paper is a local multiplayer, single button, strategy game. You take control over one of two paper mache armies. Players get to create and command miniature paper soldiers using just a single button. The entire battlefield is visible using a top-down view and the entire environment is made out of paper mache as well. The entire environment is visible to both players at all times. The resources during matches are generated automatically.

There is a background story about the planet Paperus that is invaded by the Cardboard Confederation to harvest its resourced. They are opposed by the united planetary defense force Origami Alliance. Players get to choose a side, invading or defending.
title: Paper vs Paper

description: Real Kakuro 20x20 is based on a puzzle called Kakuro. The puzzle is rather like a crossword puzzle but uses added numbers. A box is show with a \ in the middle. The number on the bottom left is for the column directly below. The number of the top right is for the row directly right. Each row or column uses the numbers 1 through 9 but each uses each number only one time and must add up to the shown number clue. This version is much the same as Real Kakuro but this time, the game board is twenty by twenty squares rather than ten by ten. The game has ads but they can be disabled with an in-game purchase.
title: Real Kakuro 20x20

description: Topotablet is an educational game that the player's geography knowledge. It is the player's task to find every major city of the world, and all that within a limited amount of time. Bonus seconds, achievements and points are rewarded every time the players finds another city. The game is played on a side-scrolling map and there is a hint function. The game is free-to-play without in-app purchases or advertisements.
title: TopoTablet
Planet Zoom and the World Inside

description: Labyrinth 2 HD is a port of the iPhone game Labyrinth 2. The port includes an additional 150 levels which are larger and designed specifically for the iPad, as well as support for larger levels in the game's level editor.
title: Labyrinth 2 HD

description:
Fates Forever is a free-to-play MOBA released exclusively for the iPad. The game plays similarly to other games in its genre such a League of Legends, the goal of each game is to destroy opposing teams home base. Each team consists of three players, as well as ai minions which regularly spawn and head towards the enemy base. The map consists of the the teams bases on either side with two lanes connecting them together. At the centre between the to lanes is an area which contains ai enemies that can be farmed for experience and money, as well as two shrines that can be captured.

Other then the main 3v3 multiplayer mode there is also a singleplayer mode where you can play a match with ai players, and a co-op mode where you and two friends can go up against an ai team.

The game features a variety of playable characters (a total of 14 when the game shut down in 2015) each of which have a passive ability and multiple skills which can be unlocked as you level up during a match. Only one of the characters are given to you at the beginning of the game, the rest have to be unlocked either with currency earned in-game or purchased with in app purchases, however rotating selection of three characters can be played for free without the need to unlock them.

The game is controlled entirely with the iPad's touch screen, you touch or hold down your finger to move your character around and target enemies. Your character's unlockable abilities are located on the side of the screen, and your items purchase from the store at your home base are located at the bottom.
title: Fates Forever

description: Bearbushkas is a 2D local multiplayer arcade game with hand-drawn cartoon graphics. Up to four players try to mark their opponents to be chased by homing missiles while at the same time trying to shake off the missiles chasing them. Extra levels add the additional challenges of navigating through an asteroid field or avoiding giant lasers that can be activated by shooting at them.
title: Bearbushkas

description:
ALFA-ARKIV is an alternate reality interactive fiction game. The app presents itself as an intelligence database that has been hijacked by freedom fighters. The player, as a new ally of this mysterious group, may access documents such as videos, confession statements, handwritten letters, etc, all of which relate to a woman named Rhea Numitorova. A member of a radical activist group called the Junsui, Rhea was detained by a Russian paramilitary organization after a failed suicide bombing. The further players go, the more they will discover about Rhea, the Junsui, and related figures and organizations, and new information will call the veracity of previous documents into question. At certain points in the story, players may communicate with a chatbot or receive in-app messages from characters, which allow the player to choose if and how they want to proceed.

The game deliberately blurs the lines between fiction and reality. Not only is its story based heavily on real-world events, but players are often asked to visit websites and download software outside of the app, which will reveal new information to further the story.
title: ALFA-ARKIV

description:
Casey's Contraptions is a physics based puzzle game that is similar to the Incredible Machine and Crazy Machines series in that it involves creating chain reactions by building various Rube Goldberg machines.

The player has to complete an objective in each level, like making balls hit a certain target, release balloons or make structures collapse. They can freely place different objects on the screen, and once they are done, press the play button. This makes the physics engine take care of the rest. Depending on the creativity of the solution, a maximum of three stars can be earned, affecting the player's rating. The game also includes a level editor and by completing chapters more items to use in it are earned.
title: Casey's Contraptions

description:
Starters Orders 4 (Flat Racing Edition) is a downgraded version of Starters Orders 4 for the Apple iPad. Unlike the PC version, which includes both flat and jumps schedules, the iPad has separate builds for each: the Flat Racing Edition and the Jumps Racing Edition. The Flat Racing Edition of the game includes UK, IRE, US and Australian game modes.

The iPad editions lack replays, race commentary, online league play facilities, jockey control options, the construction kit, user schedule creation facilities, game horse transfers, and player horse notes. They also only have one save game slot each and include only one meeting per day in-game (except from in foreign feature races). The form book and horse pool are also smaller.
title: Starters Orders 4 (Flat Racing Edition)

description:
Starters Orders 4 (Jumps Racing Edition) is a downgraded version of Starters Orders 4 for the Apple iPad. Unlike the PC version, which includes both flat and jumps schedules, the iPad has separate builds for each: the Jumps Racing Edition and the Flat Racing Edition. The Jumps Racing Edition of the game includes UK and Irish game modes.

The iPad editions lack replays, race commentary, online league play facilities, jockey control options, the construction kit, user schedule creation facilities, game horse transfers, and player horse notes. They also only have one save game slot each and include only one meeting per day in-game (except from in foreign feature races). The form book and horse pool are also smaller.
title: Starters Orders 4 (Jumps Racing Edition)

description: Game of Goose is an electronic board game translation of the game of the same name, but it must be played with up to six physical playing pieces that interact with the touch screen of the iPad using a free app. The game is sold in a pegboard plastic box and is part of the iPawn series aimed at children aged four and up.
title: Game of Goose

description: In Plundernaturs you play as a space pirate aided by your robotic parrot, P.O.L.L.Y. and you fight other pirates throughout the galaxy to earn plunder, upgrade your starship, and ultimately, find Ironbeard's legendary treasure.
title: Plundernauts
